messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Wooohoo!  First look at Shinsengumi Game Designs
messages.msgSnippet: You ll need a mod chip or some sort of device that bypasses the region setting on the ps2. Theres tons out there for the ps2. ... From: spiritus saitou To:
messages.messageBody:
You'll need a mod chip or some sort of device that bypasses the region setting on the ps2. Theres tons out there for the ps2.
----- Original Message -----
From: spiritus saitou
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, September 23, 2004 8:18 AM
Subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Wooohoo! First look at Shinsengumi Game Designs


Question for PS2 players out there...

Because this game is for Japanese release, will it still play on PS2's sold in the US? I've wondered about that.

phil

LMTame@... wrote:
If I remember correctly, Watsuki-san did the character designs for this
game, so I guess I'm not overly surprised that Saitou's sword is on the
correct side. :-D

I so can not wait to get my hands on this game . . . my three favorite
things: swords, samurai, and the Shinsengumi . .. drool . . .

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Wooohoo!  First look at Shinsengumi Game Designs
messages.msgSnippet: I doubt the game will make its way over here. As all other Shinsengumi games have not. As for the haori, the game that has the blue ones is Fuun Shinsengumi. I
messages.messageBody:
I doubt the game will make its way over here. As all other Shinsengumi games have not. As for the haori, the game that has the blue ones is Fuun Shinsengumi.

I think the left sided thing with the katana was just something they added in Mibu Gishiden to play on the fact he was left handed and to make his character a bit more interesting.



----- Original Message -----
From: Chris deMonch
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, September 22, 2004 10:03 AM
Subject: [SHQ] Re: Wooohoo! First look at Shinsengumi Game Designs


I admittedly ain't the biggest fan of when they put the swords on
the wrong side for Saito. On various Martial Arts boards there are
threads worth of lefties asking if they can train left hand over
right on the sword and then they get all huffy when they're told
that it's not done that way (for a variety of reasons, among them
being that putting the swords on the right hip instead of the left
will have you whacking saya with pretty much every other swordsman
you walk past). In Yagyu Shinkage Ryu we have a few left handed
draws and cuts, but these waza always end with the right hand
resuming its topside grip on the tsuka. Saito may have been
naturally left handed but as was said he would have been forced to
use his right hand from the time he was a small child thanks to the
conventions of the times. I dug Mibu Gishiden, but the side switch
with Saito was something that drove me nuts. I like how its done in
RK a lot better where he wears his swords on the proper side and
switches his grip when he decides to use his left handed thrust.
But anywho, wasn't there another Shinsengumi game coming out where
they're all wearing the generally accepted blue haori? Are any of
these ever going to make their way over to the U.S.?

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@h...>
wrote:
> You beat me to it ^_^ I noticed it too...the Hijikata ends up
> looking like the Fuun Shinsengumi Hijikata...so many Japanese
> messageboards like to say "its impossible he, like other lefties
> would've had to conform to the widespread etiquette of the time
> period" etc etc etc...besides the "shirts off" mode I also
recommend
> the fundoshi only mode after you have accumulated a certain number
> of points and so forth....
>
> If it is like Dynasty Warriors (where you can increase the
> skill/intelligence of your bodyguards not to mention their
> weapons)...maybe in this new Shinsengumi game you can improve on
> your squad's capabilities and give orders and employ
strategies...oh
> the possibilities...squeal
>
>
> --- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "unsafesects" <mindglue@i...> wrote:
> > --- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@h...>
> wrote:
> > > Not bad...if it has some of the detail seen in such games as
> Soul
> > > Calibur 1&2 or Onimusha then it'll be awesome...I noticed that
> the
> > > uniforms have elements of the Gohatto design...
> > >
> > > Many games allow for the customization of uniforms...e.g.
> Dynasty
> > > Warriors 4...I wonder if this game has that feature...in which
> case
> > > fangirls may choose the "no shirts" option LOL! ^_^
> >
> >
> > I am very amused by the fact that they remembered to put
Saitou's
> > katana on the righthand side so he can draw with his left hand.
> >
> > Perhaps I should not be scrutinizing these pictures as much as I
> am.
> >
> > Angrybee

the wrong side for Saito. On various Martial Arts boards there are
threads worth of lefties asking if they can train left hand over
right on the sword and then they get all huffy when they're told
that it's not done that way (for a variety of reasons, among them
being that putting the swords on the right hip instead of the left
will have you whacking saya with pretty much every other swordsman
you walk past). In Yagyu Shinkage Ryu we have a few left handed
draws and cuts, but these waza always end with the right hand
resuming its topside grip on the tsuka. Saito may have been
naturally left handed but as was said he would have been forced to
use his right hand from the time he was a small child thanks to the
conventions of the times. I dug Mibu Gishiden, but the side switch
with Saito was something that drove me nuts. I like how its done in
RK a lot better where he wears his swords on the proper side and
switches his grip when he decides to use his left handed thrust.
But anywho, wasn't there another Shinsengumi game coming out where
they're all wearing the generally accepted blue haori? Are any of
these ever going to make their way over to the U.S.?

messages.subject: Re: Wooohoo!  First look at Shinsengumi Game Designs
messages.msgSnippet: You beat me to it ^_^ I noticed it too...the Hijikata ends up looking like the Fuun Shinsengumi Hijikata...so many Japanese messageboards like to say its
messages.messageBody:
You beat me to it ^_^ I noticed it too...the Hijikata ends up
looking like the Fuun Shinsengumi Hijikata...so many Japanese
messageboards like to say "its impossible he, like other lefties
would've had to conform to the widespread etiquette of the time
period" etc etc etc...besides the "shirts off" mode I also recommend
the fundoshi only mode after you have accumulated a certain number
of points and so forth....

If it is like Dynasty Warriors (where you can increase the
skill/intelligence of your bodyguards not to mention their
weapons)...maybe in this new Shinsengumi game you can improve on
your squad's capabilities and give orders and employ strategies...oh
the possibilities...squeal

Dynasty

>

am.

> Angrybee

messages.subject: Re: Wooohoo!  First look at Shinsengumi Game Designs
messages.msgSnippet: ... I am very amused by the fact that they remembered to put Saitou s katana on the righthand side so he can draw with his left hand. Perhaps I should not be
messages.messageBody:
--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@h...> wrote:
> Not bad...if it has some of the detail seen in such games as Soul
> Calibur 1&2 or Onimusha then it'll be awesome...I noticed that the
> uniforms have elements of the Gohatto design...
>
> Many games allow for the customization of uniforms...e.g. Dynasty
> Warriors 4...I wonder if this game has that feature...in which case
> fangirls may choose the "no shirts" option LOL! ^_^


I am very amused by the fact that they remembered to put Saitou's
katana on the righthand side so he can draw with his left hand.

Perhaps I should not be scrutinizing these pictures as much as I am.

Angrybee

messages.subject: Re: Wooohoo!  First look at Shinsengumi Game Designs
messages.msgSnippet: Not bad...if it has some of the detail seen in such games as Soul Calibur 1&2 or Onimusha then it ll be awesome...I noticed that the uniforms have elements of
messages.messageBody:
Not bad...if it has some of the detail seen in such games as Soul
Calibur 1&2 or Onimusha then it'll be awesome...I noticed that the
uniforms have elements of the Gohatto design...

Many games allow for the customization of uniforms...e.g. Dynasty
Warriors 4...I wonder if this game has that feature...in which case
fangirls may choose the "no shirts" option LOL! ^_^

>
> AngryBee
